analytic.title: Thermal degradation of formamidinium based lead halide perovskites into sym-triazine and hydrogen cyanide observed by coupled thermogravimetry -mass spectrometry analysis

application.desc: GROBID - A machine learning software for extracting information from scholarly documents

div.p: Detailed calculations for estimation of maximum release achievable per meter-square of FA based perovskite based solar cell and hydrogen cyanide instantaneous concentration observed during low temperature heating tests and.

div.head: Maximum release achievable per meter-square of FA based perovskite solar cell
div.p: The weight of one thin-film of 1 m 2 of surface and 500 nm thickness of FAPbI 3 or FAPbBr 3 is

div.p: Where is the weight of perovskite contained in the thin-film of 1 m 2 of surface and 500 The maximum HCN release achievable per meter-square of FA based perovskite solar cell is,

div.p: The maximum observed hydrogen cyanide instantaneous partial pressure during low temperature heating tests was P HCN = 1.36 10 -7 torr at 85 ÂºC, see Figure S6. The equivalent HCN concentration in mg/m 3 is obtained as,

figure.head: Figure S2 .
figure.label: S2
figure.figDesc: Figure S2. Tandem TG-DTA/MS coupled experiments for FAac (formamidinium acetate). Top panel shows a one-step type mass loss TG pattern (green line). Bottom panel shows the MS traces simultaneously recorded (1-100 amu) during the experiments. There is a concurrent process of sublimation of FAac obscuring clear observation of released products during degradation.

figure.head: Figure S3 .
figure.label: S3
figure.figDesc: Figure S3. Full MS spectra (1-200 amu) for the tandem TG-DTA/MS coupled experiments shown in Figure 1 for a) FAPbI 3 and b) FAPbBr 3 .

figure.head: Figure S4 .
figure.label: S4
figure.figDesc: Figure S4. Tandem TG-DTA/MS coupled experiments for FAPbBr 3 at 3 different heating rates, 5 ÂºC/min (left), 10 ÂºC/min (center) and 20 ÂºC/min (right). Top panels show the archetypal two-step type mass loss TG patterns (green line) for FAPbBr 3 . Bottom panels show MS traces simultaneously recorded (1-100 amu) during the experiments. Gray dash lines indicate the initial temperature (time) of the first detection of the released gases during the high-temperature thermal degradation.

figure.head: Figure S5 .
figure.label: S5
figure.figDesc: Figure S5. Graphical comparisons of the theoretical fittings (solid lines) and experimental data (symbols) for TG curves during the first mass loss step of MAPbBr 3 , FAPbBr 3 , MAPbI 3 , FAPbI 3 and the unique mass loss step of precursors FAI, FABr and FAac, and all inorganic perovskite CsPbI 3 .

figure.head: Figure S6 .
figure.label: S6
figure.figDesc: Figure S6. Raw m/z ratio traces (non-calibrated) recorded for NH 3 (17 amu), NH 4 + (18 amu), HCN (27 amu), N 2 + (28 amu), formamidine HCN 2 H 3 (44 amu) and sym-triazine (54 amu) fragment.

figure.head: Figure S7 .
figure.label: S7
figure.figDesc: Figure S7. a) Mass spectrometry profiles of the empty 6-ways cross chamber recorded during illumination and heating-in-the-dark pulsed experiments. The sample holder temperature is recorded during light pulses and heating on/off intervals on the empty sample holder. b) Time dependent m/z traces of selected relevant amu registered during the thermal test of the chamber under light or dark conditions.

figure.head: Figure S8 .
figure.label: S8
figure.figDesc: Figure S8. Fragmentation patterns m/z peaks retrieved from the NIST MS library data (http://webbook.nist.gov/chemistry/) for a) ammonia, b) hydrogen cyanide, c) sym-triazine and d) hydrogen bromide.

monogr.title: The Journal of Physical Chemistry C
